edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface SubmissionInfo

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionData
public interface SubmissionInfo
extends java.io.Serializable

Implementing this interface identifies the implementing class as an exercise type specific submisssion info class.

Objects of an implementing class record certain submission made to an exercise of given type. These submissions can be visualized with SubmissionVisualizer and analyzed with SubmissionStatisticsGiver.

The SubmissionInfo classes are recorded persistently in their default serialized form (Serializable). Therefore it is important that the serialized form is dense. Do not include Vaadin-components in the serialized form of the implementor as any attached Vaadin-component has a reference to the whole Vaadin Application/UI -instance through its parent hierarchy.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Summary
 int getCorrespondingRevision()
           The revision number of the ExerciseData object this SubmissionInfo is related to as defined by #getRevision().
 

Method Detail

getCorrespondingRevision

int getCorrespondingRevision()

The revision number of the ExerciseData object this SubmissionInfo is related to as defined by #getRevision().

The ViLLE-system guarantees that incompatible (different revision) ExerciseData- and SubmissionInfo-objects are not mixed in any method receiving an object from both classes.

Returns:
the revision of the ExerciseData this submission was made to
